title: How to Make Candied Violets

steps.headline: Wash the flowers very gently.
steps.description: Use a gentle water spray with the violets sitting in a sieve. Leave the stems on the violets to allow for ease of handling when preparing the flowers.

steps.headline: Allow to dry by leaving on a kitchen paper towel, wire cake rack or sheet of plastic wrap.
Allow the egg white to warm to room temperature.
Use a fine brush to paint each flower with the egg white.
steps.description: Make sure to cover each flower completely. Do this over a piece of greaseproof paper or plastic wrap to collect drips.

steps.headline: Dust each egg-white-coated flower in a sprinkling of fine sugar.
steps.description: Make sure that each flower is well covered in sugar.

steps.headline: Remove the stems.
steps.description: Using fine scissors, snip the stems off.

steps.headline: Lay the sugar-coated flowers out on greaseproof paper or baking paper to set.
steps.description: It helps if the paper is sitting over a wire cake rack or chopping board, to make moving the flowers around easier. Move the flowers to a warm and dry place to set.

steps.headline: Allow the flowers to dry for at least 24 hours, or longer.
Heat the sugar and water until sugar is completely dissolved.
steps.description: Add the extract or rose water at the time when you are dissolving the sugar.

steps.headline: Dip each flower in liquid sugar mixture with a pair of tweezers.
steps.description: Set on wax coated paper and dust with extra-fine sugar. Make sure that each flower is well covered in sugar.

steps.headline: Remove the stems.
steps.description: Using fine scissors, snip the stems off.

steps.headline: Lay the sugar-coated flowers out on wax paper to set.
steps.description: Move the flowers to a cool and dry place to set.

methods.name: Storage and Use of Candied Violets

steps.headline: Store once dried.
steps.description: Store in an airtight glass container. If you need to layer the flowers, place a layer of baking paper between each layer to prevent the candied violets from sticking together. Keep in a cool, dry place out of direct sunlight.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: The candied violets are ready for serving any time wanted. They are great as a treat on their own or as a garnish next to a slice of cake and coulis.

tyn: Kitchen paper towel or wire rack
Fine artist or culinary brush, suitable for food
Greaseproof paper or baking paper or wax coated paper
Wire rack or chopping board for drying
